thread.title: Artists bring colour into a community by painting 209 houses in the neighbourhood
thread.title_full: Artists bring colour into a community by painting 209 houses in the neighbourhood

author: Pauline Morrissey
title: Artists bring colour into a community by painting 209 houses in the neighbourhood
text:
Artists bring colour into a community by painting 209 houses in the neighbourhood PAULINE MORRISSEY Last updated 14:58, August 4 2015 Facebook/Germen Crew 
The now colourful town of Palmitas. 
While most governments are about preventing graffiti filled streets, in a small town of Mexico, they have welcomed it. 
Authorities have collaborated with a group of street artists Germen Crew to help transform the town of Palmitas into a rainbow mural, painting all 209 homes and adding a bright and bold filter over the neighbourhood which was formerly suffering from an urban decay persona. 
Taking two and a half months to complete, the mural covers some 20,000 square meters and the artists used around 20,000 litres of paint to create the impressive work they later titled 'El Macro Mural Barrio de Palmitas'. 
The project has also seemingly improved much more than just the town's exterior appearance, violence have been said to have decreased dramatically among youths in the district comprising only 1808 people.
